pullrequest.title: Fix for bullet crashing when mesh shape files cannot be found.

content.raw:
The new test (loading from the world file) does internally call `World::LoadModel` which is the function I basically want to test. So both tests do cover the same, as the other version also uses `World::LoadModel`. What I meant is that in case either adding via insertions or loading a world file changes the way they add models at some point, they could behave differently. At the moment however  they are the same, and I guess it's very likely to stay this way too... so I reckon it would be OK to remove the initial version of the test.

I'm using the `insertion` way to add a model so that's what I wanted to test. That's the reason why the first version of the test is like it is.

Does that make sense?
content.html:
The new test (loading from the world file) does internally call World::LoadModel which is the function I basically want to test. So both tests do cover the same, as the other version also uses World::LoadModel. What I meant is that in case either adding via insertions or loading a world file changes the way they add models at some point, they could behave differently. At the moment however they are the same, and I guess it's very likely to stay this way too... so I reckon it would be OK to remove the initial version of the test.

I'm using the insertion way to add a model so that's what I wanted to test. That's the reason why the first version of the test is like it is.

Does that make sense?
